definition: one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
(of mules, horses etc) to kick backward/to kick with the hind legs/fig. to flare up in anger/to display defiance

sentences.english: Off wet sand embankment, often fear kick slide sandals.
sentences.chinese: 斷堤沙水溼，屨滑常恐蹶。

definition: one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
lit. to drop a thousand zhang in one fall (idiom)/fig. (of business, popularity etc) to suffer a sudden, devastating decline/to take a dive
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
to bestir oneself/to pull oneself together/to cheer up/to uplift/to stimulate
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
to thwart/to foil (sb's plans)/a setback/a failure/a defeat
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
